newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Wall Street to lead Belgian shares further.
newsitem.headline: Wall Street to lead Belgian shares further.

text.p: Belgian shares are expected to track Wall Street further on Tuesday after being lifted out of the red late on Monday by a firm start in New York, dealers said.
The Bel-20 closed up 1.43 points or 0.08 percent at 1,774.78 points in modest volume with 1.5 billion francs worth of shares changing hands.
Electronics group Barco was up 30 francs to 5,110 francs on reports it might join the Bel-20 next year, possibly replacing shipping company CMB or steelmaker Cockerill Sambre.
"The three main candidates to be replaced by Barco are CMB, Cockerill and (retailer) Colruyt," said a trader.

"But instead of replacing Barco perhaps they should extend the Bel-20 to the Bel-25," he said. "Foreigners like Colruyt, though it's one of three retailers in the index, and Cockerill's the only steel company in there."
Utility holding Tractebel, the day's market leader in value terms, climbed 0.2 percent to 14,750 francs with more than 24,500 shares traded.
Generale Bank's technical analysts on Monday forecast "sideways trading (for the Bel-20) with a positive bias" for the short term .
For the Bel-20, the Bank sees first resistance at 1781, second resistance at 1800, with key support levels at 1765 and 1740.
